summary: A data‑augmentation transform that randomly selects a subset of object instances identified in a single‑channel mask and removes them from both the image and the mask, optionally filling the emptied regions with a constant value or inpainting, while also updating or discarding related bounding boxes and keypoints based on configurable area and visibility thresholds.
business_intent: To increase model robustness to occlusions and missing objects by exposing training data to realistic object dropout scenarios, thereby improving performance of segmentation, detection, and pose‑estimation systems in real‑world conditions.
